page.title: 01WEASENHAM GEN' DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area we are studying is in the rural heart of the county of Norfolk.The land, which is low lying and gently undulating is nearly all laid down to arable farming.The fields are large and sometimes hedged. There are 3 very small villages in the area:Weasenham St Peter (Pop.142), Weasenham All Saints (Pop.139), and Wellingham(Pop.27).Part of South Raynham occupies the north east corner.From the south west corner to the north east runs the main A1065 road.The market towns of Swaffham lie 9miles to the south and Fakenham 7miles to the north east. The farms here are Manor Farm, High House Farm,Kipton Ash Farm and Tyth Farm in Weasenham, Manor Farm and Manor House Wellingham and Uphouse Farm Raynham.
